tourName: Fantastic Couples Tour of India’s Best: Romantic Ambiance and Intriguing Culture
placesVisited: Delhi, Agra, Fatehpur Sikri, Jaipur, Goa
generalInfo: Indulge in romance during this 9-day India couple’s tour. Whether lounging on the golden sands of a Goan beach or witnessing the marbled splendor of the Taj Mahal, this India tour embraces passionate history, colorful culture, and the splendor of the Golden Triangle. You can find wildlife, search for treasures at a traditional bazaar, and wander through the layers of preserved history in Delhi, Agra, Jaipur, and Goa.

dayInfo.title: Delhi – Arrival and Day at Leisure
dayInfo.description: Delhi hums with activity. The city’s bustle stems from daily life around antique buildings and the backstreets that hide bazaars. Your flight will land at Indira Gandhi International Airport, where your private transfer will greet you at customs. After you make your way to your gorgeous accommodation in the heart of New Delhi, you will have the remainder of the day at your leisure to settle in to the city’s wonders.

dayInfo.title: Delhi – Explore Delhi’s History and Culture
dayInfo.description: Delhi has eight distinctive districts, and the Yamuna River divides the old from the new. Your guide will meet you at your hotel for a private tour of the city’s monuments. At the Red Fort, you will discover how modern life brims within the walls of the stronghold that date back to the 17th century. The complex shines with rusty hues that stem from the red sandstone. Eventually, you will reach the Chhatta Chowk covered bazaar. Here, the aromas of curry and paratha wind through the alleys, and vendors showcase elegant silks, gems, and jewelry.

dayInfo.title: Agra – The Famous Mughal Monuments
dayInfo.description: Your private transfer will meet you at your hotel and escort you to Agra for a private tour of the city’s Mughal monuments, which are embodied in the iconic image of the Taj Mahal. Your guide will explain how the tomb acts as a testament of love from the shah to his favorite wife. The white marble facade will reflect in the glassy pools that decorate the gardens beneath the central dome. The intricate details of stone inlays and carved marble only add to the Taj Mahal’s elegant ambiance.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur – Visit Fatehpur Sikri and Transfer to Jaipur
dayInfo.description: After you depart for Jaipur, you will stop in Fatehpur Sikri to explore the 16th-century capital of the Mughal Empire. The romantic atmosphere derives from the elegant Indo-Islamic architecture that is featured in the courtyards and three palaces. The Buland Darwaza gate was built in 1601 and stands over 177 feet tall to celebrate the victory over Gujarat. Granite adornments and calligraphy decorate the sandstone and marble facade. The Tomb of Sheikh Salim Chisti was made from white marble and glows against the surrounding red courtyard and walls.

dayInfo.title: Jaipur – The Amber Fort and Jaipur’s City Center
dayInfo.description: Your guide will lead you on a private tour of the Amber Fort to begin your day. Here, the defensive walls are reflected in the water of Maota Lake. The 16th-century fortress possesses four courtyards, intricate inlaid marble patterns, and a network of underground tunnels. When discovering Jaipur’s city center, you will find the honeycombed facade of the Hawa Mahal. The pink hues and geometric accents highlight the rows of 953 tiny windows that allow the breeze to cool the narrow halls and hidden galleries.

dayInfo.title: Goa – Visit Jaipur’s Bazaars
dayInfo.description: Before departing Jaipur, you can wander through the labyrinth of the Johri Bazaar. As the aromas of watermelon and guava return to the city, you will find the sounds of vendors as they call to passersby with the promises of traditional jewelry, saris, and quilts. After you explore the colorful marketplace, your private transfer will escort you to the airport for your flight to Goa. Upon your arrival, you will meet your driver at baggage claim for a private escort to your luxury hotel that overlooks the water.

dayInfo.title: Goa – The Charms and History of Old Goa
dayInfo.description: In the morning, Goa blends the aroma of the sea breeze with the scent of chai masala tea. After breakfast, your guide will take you on a private tour of the city’s streets. During your tour, you will be able to find the aromas of fresh bread and curry. You will visit a spice farm and explore the Anjuna Market. The relaxed pace will fill the Portuguese districts, and after your tour, you can have the rest of the evening at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Goa – The Coastline and Natural Beauty of Goa
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, you can spend your morning on the gorgeous sands of Butterfly Beach. A boat ride will take you to the waters that lap against the crescent-shaped shore. Numerous butterflies will flutter around the beach above sea urchins and redfish, while dolphins play in the deep water. In the afternoon, you can visit the Bhagwan Mahavir Wildlife Sanctuary to discover over 92 square miles of landscape that supports spotted deer, Malayan pythons, giant squirrels, and jungle cats.

dayInfo.title: Goa - Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: On the outskirts of Panaji stands the four-tiered cascade of Dudhsagar Falls. The water tumbles down the powerful falls from over 1,017 feet, resulting in whitewater, mist, and a resounding roar. You can spend the morning viewing the falls before breakfast. When you are ready, your private transfer will meet you at your hotel and escort you to Goa’s Dabolim Airport. Your romantic trip to India will come to an end as you fly to Delhi and board your connecting flight home.
